meanings.definition: To outdo or surpass in jockeying or maneuvering.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Tom tried to outjockey his opponents by taking the inside track.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outjockey her competitors by strategically positioning herself at the front.
meanings.sent3: The clever rabbit outjockeyed the tortoise by hopping ahead at unexpected moments.
meanings.sent4: The skilled chess player outjockeyed his opponent by sacrificing a pawn to gain a strategic advantage.
meanings.sent5: To outjockey your rivals, you must anticipate their moves and plan your own accordingly.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outmaneuver in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: The detective was able to outjockey the criminal by setting up a clever trap.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outjockey her opponents in debates with her quick thinking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outjockeyed the dog by leading it on a wild chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox outjockeyed the hunters by doubling back and eluding them in the forest.
meanings.sent5: To outjockey your competitors, you need to stay one step ahead and anticipate their moves.
